alert.note: Alert for Hopkins; McLean; Muhlenberg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 2:10AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following counties, Hopkins, McLean and Muhlenberg. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain had moved out of the area. However, water may be slow to recede due to 3 to 5 inches of rain that occurred. The KY Mesonet station 4 miles south of Madisonville reported 4.80 inches. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madisonville, Central City, Earlington, Mortons Gap, Powderly, Graham, Greenville, Hanson, Drakesboro, Sacramento, Slaughters, Bremen and South Carrollton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
